text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/In_this_video,_we're_gonna_learn_about_Data_and_Graphs.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0002.mp4
text: Because those are such big topics, we'll only be able to cover a few key concepts in this video, but they should give you a good foundation to build on.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Because_those_are_such_big_topics,_we'll_only_be_able_to_cover_a_few_key_concepts_in_this_video,_but_they_should_give_you_a_good_foundation_to_build_on.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0003.mp4
text: Data, simply put, is information about the world.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0003.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Data,_simply_put,_is_information_about_the_world.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0004.mp4
text: The type of that data we usually deal with in math is called "quantitive data" because it involves quantities that we represent with numbers.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0004.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_type_of_that_data_we_usually_deal_with_in_math_is_called_"quantitive_data"_because_it_involves_quantities_that_we_represent_with_numbers.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0005.mp4
text: Quantitative data comes in two basic flavors.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0005.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Quantitative_data_comes_in_two_basic_flavors.pt

text: Chocolate and Vanilla?!
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0006.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Chocolate_and_Vanilla?!.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0007.mp4
text: Uh, no... continuous and discrete.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Uh,_no.pt

video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0009.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/I_would_never_order_those_flavors.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0010.mp4
text: What I really mean is that there's two basic types of data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0010.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/What_I_really_mean_is_that_there's_two_basic_types_of_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0011.mp4
text: Continuous data is data that can have any value in a range.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0011.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Continuous_data_is_data_that_can_have_any_value_in_a_range.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0012.mp4
text: For continuous data, there's an infinite number of other possible data values in-between any two actual data values.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0012.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_continuous_data,_there's_an_infinite_number_of_other_possible_data_values_in-between_any_two_actual_data_values.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0013.mp4
text: For example, if you ask an ice cream shop, how much ice cream they sold on a hot Saturday afternoon, they might tell you 14 or 15 kg.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0013.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_if_you_ask_an_ice_cream_shop,_how_much_ice_cream_they_sold_on_a_hot_Saturday_afternoon,_they_might_tell_you_14_or_15_kg.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0014.mp4
text: But they could also tell you that it was any number in-between like 14.6 kg, or even 14.625 kg if they can measure that precisely.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0014.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/But_they_could_also_tell_you_that_it_was_any_number_in-between_like_14.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0015.mp4
text: On the other hand, discrete data is data that can only have specific values.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0015.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/On_the_other_hand,_discrete_data_is_data_that_can_only_have_specific_values.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0016.mp4
text: With discrete data, there aren't any other possible data values in-between any two consecutive values.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0016.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/With_discrete_data,_there_aren't_any_other_possible_data_values_in-between_any_two_consecutive_values.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0017.mp4
text: For example, if you ask an ice cream shop how many flavors they sell, they're going to respond with a whole number like 1, 2, 3 or even 31.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0017.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_if_you_ask_an_ice_cream_shop_how_many_flavors_they_sell,_they're_going_to_respond_with_a_whole_number_like_1,_2,_3_or_even_31.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0018.mp4
text: They wouldn't give you an in-between number because they couldn't have a fractional amount like 31.4159 flavors.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0018.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/They_wouldn't_give_you_an_in-between_number_because_they_couldn't_have_a_fractional_amount_like_31.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0019.mp4
text: Ahhh! But you could mix two flavors together to get a brand new one!
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0019.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Ahhh!_But_you_could_mix_two_flavors_together_to_get_a_brand_new_one!.pt

text: [squish] I call this flavor, "Chanilla"!
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0020.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/[squish]_I_call_this_flavor,_"Chanilla"!.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0021.mp4
text: Well... anyway, you get the idea.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0021.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Well.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0022.mp4
text: Continuous data typically comes from a process of measurement, and the values you get are only limited by the precision of the measurement device you're using.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0022.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Continuous_data_typically_comes_from_a_process_of_measurement,_and_the_values_you_get_are_only_limited_by_the_precision_of_the_measurement_device_you're_using.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0023.mp4
text: However, discrete data typically comes from the process of counting, which is often limited to specific values like whole numbers or integers.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0023.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/However,_discrete_data_typically_comes_from_the_process_of_counting,_which_is_often_limited_to_specific_values_like_whole_numbers_or_integers.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0024.mp4
text: To see the difference, think about two types of data associated with a baseball player.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0024.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/To_see_the_difference,_think_about_two_types_of_data_associated_with_a_baseball_player.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0025.mp4
text: The number of home runs that a player hits each season is an example of discrete data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0025.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_number_of_home_runs_that_a_player_hits_each_season_is_an_example_of_discrete_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0026.mp4
text: It can only be a whole number.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0026.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/It_can_only_be_a_whole_number.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0027.mp4
text: But if you keep track of the average distance a player hit the ball, that would be an example of continuous data because it could be any decimal value that you could measure.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0027.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/But_if_you_keep_track_of_the_average_distance_a_player_hit_the_ball,_that_would_be_an_example_of_continuous_data_because_it_could_be_any_decimal_value_that_you_could_measure.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0028.mp4
text: Now that you know a little bit about quantitative data, let's talk about ways data can be organized or formatted.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0028.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Now_that_you_know_a_little_bit_about_quantitative_data,_let's_talk_about_ways_data_can_be_organized_or_formatted.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0029.mp4
text: Naturally, the more data that's collected, the more important it is to organize it so it does't become a chaotic jumble of numbers.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0029.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Naturally,_the_more_data_that's_collected,_the_more_important_it_is_to_organize_it_so_it_does't_become_a_chaotic_jumble_of_numbers.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0030.mp4
text: Organizing data is typically done with a "data table".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0030.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Organizing_data_is_typically_done_with_a_"data_table".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0031.mp4
text: Most data tables are made from the intersection of vertical columns and horizontal rows.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0031.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Most_data_tables_are_made_from_the_intersection_of_vertical_columns_and_horizontal_rows.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0032.mp4
text: Each box that's formed by these intersections is called a "cell" and it can hold a number or other data in it.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0032.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Each_box_that's_formed_by_these_intersections_is_called_a_"cell"_and_it_can_hold_a_number_or_other_data_in_it.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0033.mp4
text: The columns and rows have labels to help you interpret the data in the cells.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0033.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_columns_and_rows_have_labels_to_help_you_interpret_the_data_in_the_cells.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0034.mp4
text: For example, this data table shows the results of a class survey about students' favorite foods.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0034.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_this_data_table_shows_the_results_of_a_class_survey_about_students'_favorite_foods.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0035.mp4
text: It has 5 columns that are each labeled with a choice from the survey like "pizza" or "tacos".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0035.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/It_has_5_columns_that_are_each_labeled_with_a_choice_from_the_survey_like_"pizza"_or_"tacos".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0036.mp4
text: And it has a single row that's labeled "number of students".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0036.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/And_it_has_a_single_row_that's_labeled_"number_of_students".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0037.mp4
text: These labels make it easy to tell what the numbers in the cells mean.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0037.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/These_labels_make_it_easy_to_tell_what_the_numbers_in_the_cells_mean.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0038.mp4
text: For instance, this '9' is at the intersection of the column for "hamburgers" and the row for "# of students", so we know that 9 students answered "hamburgers" in the survey.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0038.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_instance,_this_'9'_is_at_the_intersection_of_the_column_for_"hamburgers"_and_the_row_for_"#_of_students",_so_we_know_that_9_students_answered_"hamburgers"_in_the_survey.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0039.mp4
text: This table happens to be in a horizontal format because there are more columns than rows, but there's no reason you couldn't switch the column and rows to get a vertical format instead.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0039.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/This_table_happens_to_be_in_a_horizontal_format_because_there_are_more_columns_than_rows,_but_there's_no_reason_you_couldn't_switch_the_column_and_rows_to_get_a_vertical_format_instead.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0040.mp4
text: These two tables contain the exact same set of data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0040.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/These_two_tables_contain_the_exact_same_set_of_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0041.mp4
text: They're just laid out differently.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0041.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/They're_just_laid_out_differently.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0042.mp4
text: Of course, the more data a table holds, the more complicated it gets.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0042.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Of_course,_the_more_data_a_table_holds,_the_more_complicated_it_gets.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0043.mp4
text: For example, this data table organizes a lot of quantitative data about the climate in Yellowstone National Park.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0043.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_this_data_table_organizes_a_lot_of_quantitative_data_about_the_climate_in_Yellowstone_National_Park.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0044.mp4
text: It's got a column for each month of the year, and several rows corresponding to weather measurements like average high and low temperature, and average precipitation and snowfall.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0044.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/It's_got_a_column_for_each_month_of_the_year,_and_several_rows_corresponding_to_weather_measurements_like_average_high_and_low_temperature,_and_average_precipitation_and_snowfall.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0045.mp4
text: A data table like this can be very useful because it can help answer questions like, "Which month is typically the warmest in Yellowstone?" If you look at all the numbers in the rows about temperature,
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0045.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/A_data_table_like_this_can_be_very_useful_because_it_can_help_answer_questions_like,_"Which_month_is_typically_the_warmest_in_Yellowstone?"_If_you_look_at_all_the_numbers_in_the_rows_about_temperature,.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0046.mp4
text: You'll see that the highest numbers are in the column labeled "July".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0046.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/You'll_see_that_the_highest_numbers_are_in_the_column_labeled_"July".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0047.mp4
text: But, there's something that would be even more useful than a data table for answering questions like that, ...and that something is called a "graph".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0047.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/But,_there's_something_that_would_be_even_more_useful_than_a_data_table_for_answering_questions_like_that,_.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0048.mp4
text: Graphs are visual representations of data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0048.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Graphs_are_visual_representations_of_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0049.mp4
text: Instead of using rows and columns of numbers, graphs use a variety of visual elements like points, lines, rectangles or other graphics to make a picture of the data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0049.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Instead_of_using_rows_and_columns_of_numbers,_graphs_use_a_variety_of_visual_elements_like_points,_lines,_rectangles_or_other_graphics_to_make_a_picture_of_the_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0050.mp4
text: To see how helpful graphs can be, let's focus on the row of data that records average precipitation (or rainfall) and see a graph of that data only.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0050.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/To_see_how_helpful_graphs_can_be,_let's_focus_on_the_row_of_data_that_records_average_precipitation_(or_rainfall)_and_see_a_graph_of_that_data_only.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0051.mp4
text: This particular type of graph is called a "bar graph" or a "bar chart" because it uses rectangular bars to represent numeric values.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0051.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/This_particular_type_of_graph_is_called_a_"bar_graph"_or_a_"bar_chart"_because_it_uses_rectangular_bars_to_represent_numeric_values.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0052.mp4
text: Just like the data table, the graph has labels on two of its sides.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0052.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Just_like_the_data_table,_the_graph_has_labels_on_two_of_its_sides.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0053.mp4
text: These sides are called the "axes" of the graph.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0053.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/These_sides_are_called_the_"axes"_of_the_graph.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0054.mp4
text: The horizontal axis on the bottom lists the months of the year, while the vertical axis on the left side has a sequence of numbers to show the precipitation in inches.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0054.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_horizontal_axis_on_the_bottom_lists_the_months_of_the_year,_while_the_vertical_axis_on_the_left_side_has_a_sequence_of_numbers_to_show_the_precipitation_in_inches.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0055.mp4
text: As you might expect, the height of the bars in a bar graph correspond exactly with the numbers in the table.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0055.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/As_you_might_expect,_the_height_of_the_bars_in_a_bar_graph_correspond_exactly_with_the_numbers_in_the_table.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0056.mp4
text: You can see that by looking at the scale on the vertical axis.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0056.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/You_can_see_that_by_looking_at_the_scale_on_the_vertical_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0057.mp4
text: The data table tells us that the average rainfall for the month of May is 2 inches, and the height of the bar for that month on the graph exactly matches the 2 inch mark on the vertical axis.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0057.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_data_table_tells_us_that_the_average_rainfall_for_the_month_of_May_is_2_inches,_and_the_height_of_the_bar_for_that_month_on_the_graph_exactly_matches_the_2_inch_mark_on_the_vertical_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0058.mp4
text: You can almost imagine that a rain cloud came along and filled up the bar to that level.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0058.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/You_can_almost_imagine_that_a_rain_cloud_came_along_and_filled_up_the_bar_to_that_level.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0059.mp4
text: Notice how easily the graph lets us to see how the rainfall changes throughout the year.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0059.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Notice_how_easily_the_graph_lets_us_to_see_how_the_rainfall_changes_throughout_the_year.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0060.mp4
text: We can quickly find the highest and lowest months because our brains are able to compare the size of the bars much faster than they can compare the numbers in the table.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0060.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/We_can_quickly_find_the_highest_and_lowest_months_because_our_brains_are_able_to_compare_the_size_of_the_bars_much_faster_than_they_can_compare_the_numbers_in_the_table.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0061.mp4
text: That's why bar graphs are such useful tools for representing quantitative data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0061.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/That's_why_bar_graphs_are_such_useful_tools_for_representing_quantitative_data.pt

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Here's_another_bar_graph_that's_made_from_the_row_of_data_showing_average_snowfall.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0065.mp4
text: And by looking at the scale on the left side of the graph, you can see that bar represents 14.5 inches of snow.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/And_by_looking_at_the_scale_on_the_left_side_of_the_graph,_you_can_see_that_bar_represents_14.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0066.mp4
text: Notice that these two different bar graphs have different number sequences (or scales) on their vertical axes.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0066.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Notice_that_these_two_different_bar_graphs_have_different_number_sequences_(or_scales)_on_their_vertical_axes.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0067.mp4
text: The rainfall graph starts at a minimum value of 0 inches and goes up to a maximum value of 2.5 inches, while the snowfall graph starts at 0 and goes up to a max of 16.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0067.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_rainfall_graph_starts_at_a_minimum_value_of_0_inches_and_goes_up_to_a_maximum_value_of_2.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0068.mp4
text: Also notice that each graph uses a different size subdivision on the vertical axis.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0068.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Also_notice_that_each_graph_uses_a_different_size_subdivision_on_the_vertical_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0069.mp4
text: The rainfall graph has a division every 0.5 inches while the snowfall graph has a division every 2 inches.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_rainfall_graph_has_a_division_every_0.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0070.mp4
text: The size of these subdivisions is called the "interval" of that axis.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_size_of_these_subdivisions_is_called_the_"interval"_of_that_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0071.mp4
text: This combination of a minimum value and maximum value and interval form the "scale" of an axis.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/This_combination_of_a_minimum_value_and_maximum_value_and_interval_form_the_"scale"_of_an_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0072.mp4
text: When making a graph, it's very important to choose a scale that does a good job of displaying the data in a clear and understandable way.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/When_making_a_graph,_it's_very_important_to_choose_a_scale_that_does_a_good_job_of_displaying_the_data_in_a_clear_and_understandable_way.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0073.mp4
text: For example, if we used the same scale for the rainfall data as we did for the snowfall data, our graph would look like this.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_if_we_used_the_same_scale_for_the_rainfall_data_as_we_did_for_the_snowfall_data,_our_graph_would_look_like_this.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0074.mp4
text: That's not good! Now you can hardly tell the difference between the heights of the bars because they're all squished down below the 2 inch mark.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/That's_not_good!_Now_you_can_hardly_tell_the_difference_between_the_heights_of_the_bars_because_they're_all_squished_down_below_the_2_inch_mark.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0075.mp4
text: Likewise, if we used the scale of the rainfall graph for the snowfall data, a lot of the values would be off the chart!

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Likewise,_if_we_used_the_scale_of_the_rainfall_graph_for_the_snowfall_data,_a_lot_of_the_values_would_be_off_the_chart!.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0076.mp4
text: So keep that in mind if you ever need to draw a graph yourself.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/So_keep_that_in_mind_if_you_ever_need_to_draw_a_graph_yourself.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0077.mp4
text: You'll want to pay close attention to the range of values in the data set so that you can choose a minimum, maximum and interval that are a good match for the data you need to graph.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/You'll_want_to_pay_close_attention_to_the_range_of_values_in_the_data_set_so_that_you_can_choose_a_minimum,_maximum_and_interval_that_are_a_good_match_for_the_data_you_need_to_graph.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0078.mp4
text: For example, what if you have a data table that contains negative values?

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_what_if_you_have_a_data_table_that_contains_negative_values?.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0079.mp4
text: ...like this one that tracks how much money an investor made during each month of a year.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0080.mp4
text: The highest monthly gain was $800, but there are some months with negative numbers like negative 400 which means the investor lost money.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_highest_monthly_gain_was_$800,_but_there_are_some_months_with_negative_numbers_like_negative_400_which_means_the_investor_lost_money.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0081.mp4
text: Fortunately, bar graphs can be adapted to handle negative values too.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0081.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Fortunately,_bar_graphs_can_be_adapted_to_handle_negative_values_too.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0082.mp4
text: All you need to do is extend the vertical axis scale using negative values that go below the horizontal axis.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/All_you_need_to_do_is_extend_the_vertical_axis_scale_using_negative_values_that_go_below_the_horizontal_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0083.mp4
text: That way you can display negative values as bars that go down instead of up.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/That_way_you_can_display_negative_values_as_bars_that_go_down_instead_of_up.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0084.mp4
text: Pretty cool, huh?

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0085.mp4
text: Of course, bar graphs aren't the only way to turn data into a graph.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Of_course,_bar_graphs_aren't_the_only_way_to_turn_data_into_a_graph.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0086.mp4
text: There are actually many different kinds of graphs, some of which are better than others for certain types of data.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/There_are_actually_many_different_kinds_of_graphs,_some_of_which_are_better_than_others_for_certain_types_of_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0087.mp4

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Unfortunately,_we_don't_have_time_to_cover_all_these_different_graphs_in_this_video.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0088.mp4
text: Instead, we'll just focus on one more very common option called a "line graph".

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Instead,_we'll_just_focus_on_one_more_very_common_option_called_a_"line_graph".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0089.mp4
text: Line graphs are great for many types of data, especially data about how things change over time.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Line_graphs_are_great_for_many_types_of_data,_especially_data_about_how_things_change_over_time.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0090.mp4
text: The Yellowstone data table we saw previously also had data showing how the average high and low temperatures change throughout a typical year.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/The_Yellowstone_data_table_we_saw_previously_also_had_data_showing_how_the_average_high_and_low_temperatures_change_throughout_a_typical_year.pt

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Here's_a_line_graph_of_just_the_high_temperature_data.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0092.mp4
text: If we compare it to the bar graph we made for the precipitation data, you'll notice that the bar graph only had horizontal interval lines for tracking values on the vertical axis, while the line graph also has vertical interval lines for tracking values on the horizontal axis.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/If_we_compare_it_to_the_bar_graph_we_made_for_the_precipitation_data,_you'll_notice_that_the_bar_graph_only_had_horizontal_interval_lines_for_tracking_values_on_the_vertical_axis,_while_the_line_graph_also_has_vertical_interval_lines_for_tracking_values_on_the_horizontal_axis.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0093.mp4
text: These two sets of lines form a grid that makes it easier to locate individual data points on the graph.

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/These_two_sets_of_lines_form_a_grid_that_makes_it_easier_to_locate_individual_data_points_on_the_graph.pt

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_instance,_notice_that_for_the_month_of_June,_there's_a_dot_exactly_at_the_intersection_of_the_vertical_line_for_June_and_the_horizontal_line_for_70_deg.pt

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/That_matches_perfectly_with_the_data_in_the_table_which_shows_an_average_temperature_of_70_degrees_in_June.pt

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/After_all_these_dots_were_plotted_on_the_graph,_they_were_connected_with_line_segments_between_each_adjacent_pair.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0098.mp4
text: Why was this done?

text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Why_was_this_done?.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0099.mp4
text: ...to help us identify any "trends" in the data.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0099.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0100.mp4
text: A trend is simply a pattern in the data; like increasing, decreasing or staying basically the same.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0100.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/A_trend_is_simply_a_pattern_in_the_data;_like_increasing,_decreasing_or_staying_basically_the_same.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0101.mp4
text: Identifying these sorts of trends in data can be helpful in a couple different ways.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0101.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Identifying_these_sorts_of_trends_in_data_can_be_helpful_in_a_couple_different_ways.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0102.mp4
text: First, trends can help you understand data on a higher or more general level.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0102.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/First,_trends_can_help_you_understand_data_on_a_higher_or_more_general_level.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0103.mp4
text: For example, the trend in this Yellowstone data is that the temperature increases from January to July, and then decreases from August to December.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0103.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_the_trend_in_this_Yellowstone_data_is_that_the_temperature_increases_from_January_to_July,_and_then_decreases_from_August_to_December.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0104.mp4
text: And second, trends can sometimes help you make predictions about what might happen in the future.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0104.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/And_second,_trends_can_sometimes_help_you_make_predictions_about_what_might_happen_in_the_future.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0105.mp4
text: For example, if you have a line graph showing how the population of a bison herd was changing over time, it might help you predict how many bison you'd expect to see the next year.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0105.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_if_you_have_a_line_graph_showing_how_the_population_of_a_bison_herd_was_changing_over_time,_it_might_help_you_predict_how_many_bison_you'd_expect_to_see_the_next_year.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0106.mp4
text: So line graphs are great for displaying data in a way that lets you quickly identify trends.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0106.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/So_line_graphs_are_great_for_displaying_data_in_a_way_that_lets_you_quickly_identify_trends.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0107.mp4
text: Another strength of line graphs is that they make it fairly easy to plot and compare multiple sets of data on them using different lines.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0107.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Another_strength_of_line_graphs_is_that_they_make_it_fairly_easy_to_plot_and_compare_multiple_sets_of_data_on_them_using_different_lines.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0108.mp4
text: Like, we could easily add the data for the average low temperature from our table using another line like so.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0108.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Like,_we_could_easily_add_the_data_for_the_average_low_temperature_from_our_table_using_another_line_like_so.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0109.mp4
text: Multi-line graphs like this will usually use different colors or line styles to help you tell which line is which.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0109.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Multi-line_graphs_like_this_will_usually_use_different_colors_or_line_styles_to_help_you_tell_which_line_is_which.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0110.mp4
text: But like all types of graphs, line graphs have some limitations too.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0110.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/But_like_all_types_of_graphs,_line_graphs_have_some_limitations_too.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0111.mp4
text: For example, do you remember our first set of data about students' favorite foods?
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0111.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/For_example,_do_you_remember_our_first_set_of_data_about_students'_favorite_foods?.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0112.mp4
text: Well... here's a bar graph and a line graph of that data side-by-side.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0112.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Well.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0113.mp4
text: Can you think of a reason why the line graph wouldn't be a good way to represent this data?
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0113.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Can_you_think_of_a_reason_why_the_line_graph_wouldn't_be_a_good_way_to_represent_this_data?.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0114.mp4
text: Yep... it's because the options on the horizontal axis aren't related by any natural sequence.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0114.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Yep.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0115.mp4
text: It doesn't really matter which order the different foods are listed in.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0115.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/It_doesn't_really_matter_which_order_the_different_foods_are_listed_in.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0116.mp4
text: And because the order isn't important, any trend you might see by using a line graph doesn't have any real meaning.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0116.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/And_because_the_order_isn't_important,_any_trend_you_might_see_by_using_a_line_graph_doesn't_have_any_real_meaning.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0117.mp4
text: In fact, it could actually be misleading to use a line graph for data like this because it also implies there could be choices in-between the survey options like "taco-pizza" or "pizza-hamburgers".
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0117.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/In_fact,_it_could_actually_be_misleading_to_use_a_line_graph_for_data_like_this_because_it_also_implies_there_could_be_choices_in-between_the_survey_options_like_"taco-pizza"_or_"pizza-hamburgers".pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0118.mp4
text: So in cases like this, it's better to just stick with a bar graph so people don't get confused.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0118.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/So_in_cases_like_this,_it's_better_to_just_stick_with_a_bar_graph_so_people_don't_get_confused.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0119.mp4
text: That's why line graphs are often used for data that occurs over time.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0119.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/That's_why_line_graphs_are_often_used_for_data_that_occurs_over_time.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0120.mp4
text: Time forms a natural sequence where trend lines make sense and there are always possible values in-between whatever time interval is used on the graph.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0120.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Time_forms_a_natural_sequence_where_trend_lines_make_sense_and_there_are_always_possible_values_in-between_whatever_time_interval_is_used_on_the_graph.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0121.mp4
text: Alright, so now you have a basic idea of how data and graphs work.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0121.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/Alright,_so_now_you_have_a_basic_idea_of_how_data_and_graphs_work.pt

video: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0122.mp4
text: You've learned about continuous and discrete data and how it's organized using data tables.
video_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/clip_0122.pt
text_latent: ./clip_video/Math Antics - Data And Graphs [hcgThf5mv38]/videos/You've_learned_about_continuous_and_discrete_data_and_how_it's_organized_using_data_tables.pt
